Title: Sanwo-Olu approves establishment of Apapa Central Business District
Summary: Lagos State Governor, Mr. Babajide Sanwo-Olu, has approved the establishment of the Apapa Central Business Office to tackle infrastructure maintenance challenges . The Special Adviser to the Governor on CBD, Bola Olumegbon-Lawal, made this known .

Title: Why Dagrin didn’t live long – Kenny Saint Brown
Summary: Gospel singer and former Kennis Music artiste, Kenny Saint Brown, has said that late rapper Dagrin did not ask God for long life in his verse on her 2010 prayer-themed song, “Turn Me Around” She made this known during an interview .

Title: Gunmen kill eight, injure many in Plateau community
Summary: The gunmen also burnt down several homes and carted away foodstuffs . It was gathered that the gunmen killed eight people at the Wereng camp community .

Title: Inflation drops to 23.71% in April
Summary: The headline inflation rate for April 2025 eased to 23.71 per cent relative to the March 2025 inflation rate of 24.23 per cent . This represents a decrease of 0.52 per cent from March 2025 . The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS)

Title: Renewed Boko Haram attacks on military formations are just an eclipse – CDS Musa
Summary: Boko Haram/ISWAP attacks on military formations and communities in Borno, Yobe, and Adamawa states are merely an eclipse . Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Christopher Musa, described the attacks as merely an 'eclipse' Musa said .

Title: Boko Haram attacks: Nigeria to deploy sophisticated weapons to end terrorism – CDS
Summary: Nigeria to deploy sophisticated weapons to end terrorism – CDS . "We have also procured more sophisticated weapons which will soon be deployed with a new strategies to end Terrorism"

Title: Bitcoin dips below $102K as Russia-Ukraine peace talks face uncertainty
Summary: Valeria Marquez, a 23-year-old social media influencer from Mexico, has been shot and killed while live streaming on TikTok at her beauty salon in Guadalajara, local authorities have confirmed .

Title: Bayelsa Electricity Company to install new 60mw gas turbine
Summary: Bayelsa Electricity Company to install new 60mw gas turbine . Managing Director Olice Kemenanabo assured that the December completion date of the project is still feasible .

Title: We may extend student loans to private institutions within 3 years – NELFUND
Summary: The Nigerian Education Loan Fund (NELFUND) has revealed that private institutions in Nigeria could benefit from the federal government’s student loan scheme within the next three years .

Title: Defection: Our goal is to move Delta forward, not kill PDP – Oborevwori
Summary: Governor Sheriff Oborevwori has stated that his recent political realignment is aimed at advancing the state’s development, not destroying the Peoples Democratic Party . He said the decision to defect to the All Progressives Congress was informed by the political realities ahead of the 2027 general elections . Governor also revealed plans to mark the administration

Title: Compulsory voting bill sparks debate in House of Reps
Summary: Two opposition lawmakers raised concerns over a bill seeking to amend the Electoral Act, 2022, to make voting compulsory for Nigerians of voting age in all national and state elections . The bill, sponsored by Speaker of the House of Representatives, Tajudeen Abbas, and Daniel Asama (Plateau), scaled second reading during plenary .

Title: 2027: Nwosu declares ADC as Nigeria's coalition party
Summary: National Chairman of the African Democratic Congress, Ralph Nwosu, has announced ADC as Nigeria’s coalition party in preparation for the 2027 election . Title: Protest: Contractors, IBEDC clash over alleged exploitation in Osun
Summary: Members of the Licensed Electrical Contractors Association of Nigeria, Osun State chapter, took to the streets in protest over alleged unethical practices by staff of the Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company . Title: Flood: NEMA deploys teams to states, urges state-level readiness
Summary: The National Emergency Management Agency is deploying teams to all the states in the country to engage directly with communities identified as being at risk of flooding . 12 states, including the Federal Capital Territory, with 27 LGAs, are considered to fall within the moderate flood-risk areas .
